project.name: controltier-installer
project.description: Build script to install ControlTier Server and Client. Used by the install.sh script.

target.name: -load-props
target.description: Configures default properties and loads the configuration from default.properties

then.fail: ERROR: System hostname could not be determined. Please specify with -Dsystem.hostname=<value> on the commandline.
server.hostname is not set. For client installation, set server.hostname in defaults.properties, or on commandline via -Dserver.hostname=<value>
Unable to install: Java version 1.5 is required. (ant.java.version = "${ant.java.version}")

target.name: execute
target.echo:
Startup:
On Unix start Jetty by running: "$JETTY_HOME/bin/jetty.sh start" or on Windows run: "%JETTY_HOME%\bin\start.bat"
Once you have started Jetty, visit this URL to access ControlTier web applications:
http://${server.hostname}:${server.jetty.port}/
NOTE: ControlTier Client requires that SSH is configured to allow key-based authentication from the ${server.hostname} host. Ensure that the public key has been added to the authorized_keys file.

then.fail: Unable to determine cygwin version of JAVA_HOME: ${USER_ENV.JAVA_HOME}
then.echo:
# Server settings
export JETTY_HOME=${server.jetty.home.escbackslash} export JETTY_LOGS=${server.jetty.home.escbackslash}/logs export JETTY_RUN=$JETTY_LOGS export JAVA_HOME=${env.java_home.escbackslash} CONFIG_PROPS="-Djobcenter.config.location=${env.ctier_root.escbackslash}/jobcenter/jobcenter-config.properties -Dreportcenter.config.location=${env.ctier_root.escbackslash}/reportcenter/reportcenter-config.properties" export JAVA_OPTIONS="-XX:MaxPermSize=128m -Xmx1024m -Xms256m $CONFIG_PROPS"

export PATH=${rcfile.path}
if [ -n "$BASH" ] ; then . $CTL_HOME\\etc\\bash_completion.sh ; if [ -t 0 -a -z "$CTL_CLI_TERSE" ] then CTL_CLI_TERSE=true export CTL_CLI_TERSE fi fi

:: Server settings
set JETTY_HOME=${server.jetty.home.converted} set JETTY_LOGS=${server.jetty.home.converted}\logs set JETTY_RUN=%JETTY_LOGS% set CONFIG_PROPS=-Djobcenter.config.location=${env.ctier_root}\jobcenter\jobcenter-config.properties -Dreportcenter.config.location=${env.ctier_root}\reportcenter\reportcenter-config.properties set JAVA_HOME=${USER_ENV.JAVA_HOME} set JAVA_OPTIONS=-XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Xmx768m -Xms256m %CONFIG_PROPS%

# Server settings
export JETTY_HOME=${server.jetty.home} export JETTY_LOGS=${server.jetty.home.converted}/logs export JETTY_RUN=$JETTY_LOGS export JAVA_HOME=${USER_ENV.JAVA_HOME} CONFIG_PROPS="-Djobcenter.config.location=${env.ctier_root}/jobcenter/jobcenter-config.properties -Dreportcenter.config.location=${env.ctier_root}/reportcenter/reportcenter-config.properties" export JAVA_OPTIONS="-XX:MaxPermSize=128m -Xmx1024m -Xms256m $CONFIG_PROPS"

else.echo:
export PATH=${rcfile.path}
if [ -n "$BASH" ] ; then . $CTL_HOME/etc/bash_completion.sh ; if [ -t 0 -a -z "$CTL_CLI_TERSE" ] then CTL_CLI_TERSE=true export CTL_CLI_TERSE fi fi

target.name: -backup-server-config
target.description: backup config files that would get overwritten

target.name: echo-rcfile-info
target.description: Prints information about location and content of .ctierrc file.

then.echo:
A .ctierrc file was generated at: ${rcpath.converted} containing the appropriate environment variables for the installed ControlTier Client To use it, add the following to your .profile or equivalent:
if [ -f ~/.ctierrc ]; then . ~/.ctierrc else echo ~/.ctierrc not found 1>&2 fi

else.echo:
A ctier.bat file was generated at: ${user.home}\${installer.rcbatfilename}
It defines necessary environment variables and should be executed prior to starting up the jetty server.

else.fail: Sorry, the installer does not currently support your operating system.

then.echo: Warning: JRE_HOME is set and differs from JAVA_HOME:
This sofware requires a JDK environment.
Consider unsetting JRE_HOME or set JRE_HOME=JAVA_HOME

then.fail: Server installation is not supported on cygwin. Use the --client flag to install the client only.

fail-if-not-dir.name: server.jetty.home
fail-if-not-dir.mesg: , server.jetty.home should be a valid Jetty installation

fail-if-not-dir.name: server.jetty.base
fail-if-not-dir.mesg: , server.jetty.base should be a valid Jetty base

then.fail: server.jetty.home and server.jetty.base must be the same for automatic Jetty installation.

The realm.properties file was not found: ${server.jetty.base}/etc/realm.properties To have a default realm.properties file used, please set the "users.install-default" property to "true" inside "default.properties".
